etymology.description: semantic: 士(士) (shì, "scholar") + semantic: 丨(丨) (gǔn, "line") + phonetic: 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") + semantic: 卄(卄) (niàn, "twenty") = complexity and firmness in writing -> formal numeral "one"
etymology.interpretation: The character 壹(壹) (yī, "one") was formed to represent the numeral one in formal contexts, distinguished from 一(一) (yī, "one"). Its components suggest formality and completeness.
etymology.simplification: In simplified Chinese, 壹(壹) remains the same as it retains its formal and specific usage.

examples.chinese: 我有壹本书(我有壹本書)。
他只买壹件衬衫(他只買壹件襯衫)，不买其他(不買其他)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhǐ mǎi yī jiàn chènshān, bù mǎi qítā.
examples.english: He only bought one shirt and did not buy anything else.

examples.chinese: 壹个苹果(壹個蘋果)足以代表开始(足以代表開始)。
examples.pinyin: Yī gè píngguǒ zúyǐ dàibiǎo kāishǐ.
examples.english: One apple is enough to represent a beginning.
